{{Use mdy dates|date=December 2018}} {{Use American English|date=September 2018}} {{Infobox football biography | name = DeAndre Yedlin | image = DeAndre Yedlin training 2014 Brazil (cropped).jpg | image_size = 200 | caption = Yedlin playing for the [[United States men's national soccer team|United States]] in 2014 | fullname = DeAndre Roselle Yedlin<ref>{{cite news|title = 2014 FIFA World Cup Brazil: List of Players|url=http://www.fifadata.com/document/fwc/2014/pdf/fwc_2014_squadlists.pdf|publisher=FIFA|format=PDF|page=32|date=June 11, 2014|accessdate=June 11, 2014}}</ref> | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1993|7|9}} | birth_place = [[Seattle|Seattle, Washington]], United States | height = {{height|ft=5|in=8}}<ref>{{cite web |url= http://www.premierleague.com/en-gb/players/profile.overview.html/deandre-yedlin |title= Premier League Player Profile DeAndre Yedlin |author=<!--Staff writer(s); no by-line.--> |date= 2015 |website= Premier League |publisher= Barclays Premier League|accessdate= January 20, 2015}}</ref> | position = [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|Right back]] | currentclub = [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] | clubnumber = 22 | youthyears1 = 2004–2006 | youthclubs1 = Emerald City FC | youthyears2 = 2006–2008 | youthclubs2 = Northwest Nationals | youthyears3 = 2008–2010 | youthclubs3 = Crossfire Premier | youthyears4 = 2010–2011 | youthclubs4 = [[Seattle Sounders FC]] | collegeyears1 = 2011–2012 | college1 = [[Akron Zips men's soccer|Akron Zips]] | collegecaps1 = 45 | collegegoals1 = 1 | years1 = 2012 | clubs1 = [[Seattle Sounders FC U-23]] | caps1 = 16 | goals1 = 1 | years2 = 2013–2014 | clubs2 = [[Seattle Sounders FC]] | caps2 = 56 | goals2 = 1<!-- LEAGUE ONLY --> | years3 = 2015–2016 | clubs3 = [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] | caps3 = 1 | goals3 = 0 | years4 = 2015–2016 | clubs4 = → [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] (loan) | caps4 = 23 | goals4 = 0 | years5 = 2016– | clubs5 = [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] | caps5 = 86 | goals5 = 2 | nationalyears1 = 2013 | nationalteam1 = [[United States men's national under-20 soccer team|United States U20]] | nationalcaps1 = 4 | nationalgoals1 = 0 | nationalyears2 = 2014– | nationalteam2 = [[United States men's national soccer team|United States]] | nationalcaps2 = 57 | nationalgoals2 = 0 | medaltemplates = | club-update = 17:45, 23 February 2019 (UTC) | nationalteam-update = November 15, 2018 }}
'''DeAndre Roselle Yedlin''' (born July 9, 1993) is an American professional [[Association football|soccer]] player who plays for [[Premier League]] club [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] and the [[United States men's national soccer team|United States national team]]. Primarily a [[Defender (association football)#Full-back|right back]], Yedlin has also featured as a [[Defender (association football)#Wing-back|wingback]] and [[Midfielder#Wide midfielder|wide midfielder]].<ref name=autogenerated3>[https://books.google.com/books?id=aao_DwAAQBAJ&pg=PA170&dq=DeAndre+Yedlin&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjGhuCdg4ncAhXKipQKHRlyCekQ6AEIRzAF#v=onepage&q=DeAndre%20Yedlin&f=false ''The Real Giants of Soccer Coaching: Insights and Wisdom from the Game's ...'' – Josh Faga<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
==Club career==
===Youth, college, and amateur=== A product of [[O'Dea High School]] in [[Seattle]], Yedlin was part of Washington Youth Soccer’s State Olympic Development Program (ODP) from 2006 to 2009. He also played youth soccer for [[Emerald City Football Club|Emerald City FC]] and Northwest Nationals before going to [[U.S. Soccer Development Academy]] club Crossfire Premier.<ref name=autogenerated3 /> Yedlin stayed in the DA, but moved to the [[Seattle Sounders FC]] youth academy for the 2010–11 season.<ref name=deandre_yedlin>{{cite web|title=Washington Youth Soccer Alum DeAndre Yedlin Signs Pro Contract With Sounders FC|url=http://www.washingtonyouthsoccer.org/washington_youth_soccer_alum_deandre_yedlin_signs_pro_contract_with_sounders_fc/|publisher=Washington Youth Soccer|accessdate=March 2, 2013}}</ref>
On February 8, 2011, Yedlin signed a [[letter of intent]] to play college soccer at the [[University of Akron]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Six All-Americans Highlight Men's Soccer Signing Class|url=http://www.gozips.com/sports/msoc/2011-12/releases/205087402_1|work=GoZips.com|publisher=University of Akron|accessdate=March 2, 2013|date=February 8, 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130511224638/http://www.gozips.com/sports/msoc/2011-12/releases/205087402_1|archive-date=May 11, 2013|dead-url=yes}}</ref><ref name=autogenerated4>[https://books.google.com/books?id=_wgyBgAAQBAJ&pg=PA225&dq=DeAndre+Yedlin&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjGhuCdg4ncAhXKipQKHRlyCekQ6AEINTAC#v=onepage&q=DeAndre%20Yedlin&f=false ''American Soccer: History, Culture, Class'' – Gregory G. Reck, Bruce Allen Dick<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> In his freshman year, Yedlin started in 20 of his 23 games for the Zips. He scored his first collegiate goal on September 28, 2011, in a 3–1 victory over [[Ohio State Buckeyes|Ohio State]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Attendance Record Falls as Zips Blitz Buckeyes, 3–1|url=http://www.gozips.com/sports/msoc/2011-12/releases/20110928rccqbi|work=GoZips.com|publisher=University of Akron|accessdate=March 2, 2013|date=September 28, 2011|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130511210715/http://www.gozips.com/sports/msoc/2011-12/releases/20110928rccqbi|archive-date=May 11, 2013|dead-url=yes}}</ref> He finished the year with six assists. In his sophomore year, Yedlin made 22 appearances and finished the year with six assists as well.<ref>[https://heavy.com/news/2014/06/deandre-yedlin-seattle-sounders-world-cup-position-salary-parents-girlfriend-position-hair-ethnicity/ "DeAndre Yedlin: 5 Fast Facts You Need to Know" | Heavy.com<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
Yedlin also played for [[Seattle Sounders FC U-23]] in the [[Premier Development League]], and was named to the 2012 All-PDL First XI for his play.<ref name="sounders_u23">{{cite web|title=2012 Seattle Sounders FC U-23 stats|url=http://www.uslsoccer.com/teams/2012/4480101.html#STATS|work=uslsoccer.com|publisher=United Soccer Leagues|accessdate=March 2, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130203151103/http://www.uslsoccer.com/teams/2012/4480101.html#STATS|archive-date=February 3, 2013|dead-url=yes}}</ref>
===Seattle Sounders FC=== [[File:DeAndre Yedlin 2014 US Open Cup.jpg|thumb|upright|left|Yedlin playing for [[Seattle Sounders FC]] in 2014]]
On January 11, 2013, after two seasons with Akron, Yedlin signed with [[Seattle Sounders FC]] as the club's first [[Homegrown Player Rule (Major League Soccer)|homegrown player]].<ref name="deandre_yedlin"/><ref>{{cite web|title=DeAndre Yedlin Signs Homegrown Contract With Seattle Sounders|url=http://www.gozips.com/sports/msoc/2012-13/releases/2013011151ernc|work=GoZips.com|publisher=University of Akron|accessdate=March 2, 2013|date=January 11, 2013|archive-url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130511202504/http://www.gozips.com/sports/msoc/2012-13/releases/2013011151ernc|archive-date=May 11, 2013|dead-url=yes}}</ref><ref>{{cite web|title=Sounders FC Signs First Homegrown Player|url=http://www.soundersfc.com/news/articles/2013/01-january/yedlin-press-release.aspx|work=soundersfc.com|publisher=Sounders FC Public Relations|accessdate=March 2, 2013|date=January 11, 2013}}</ref><ref name=autogenerated3 /> He made his debut on March 2 in a 1–0 home defeat to the [[Montreal Impact]].<ref>{{cite web |title=MLS Match Recap: Montreal Impact 1, Seattle Sounders 0 |url=http://www.mlssoccer.com/matchcenter/2013-03-02-SEA-v-MTL/recap |work=MLSsoccer.com |publisher=Major League Soccer |accessdate=March 3, 2013 |date=March 2, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130304220729/http://www.mlssoccer.com/matchcenter/2013-03-02-sea-v-mtl/recap |archivedate=March 4, 2013 }}</ref> Yedlin was named to the MLS Team of the Week for his performance, becoming the first rookie to earn the honor in his professional debut.<ref>{{cite web|title=MLS Team of the Week (Week 1)|url=http://www.mlssoccer.com/news/article/2013/03/05/team-week-wk-1-stars-shine-opening-weekend}}</ref> On March 12 he scored his first professional goal for the club in a 3–1 win against [[Tigres UANL|Tigres]] in the second leg of the Sounders 3–2 [[CONCACAF Champions League]] quarterfinal aggregate victory.
On July 15, Yedlin was named to the [[2013 MLS All-Star Game|MLS All-Star team]] for their match against [[A.S. Roma|Roma]] on July 31, making him the first rookie to be named to the All-Star team since 2005 when [[Michael Parkhurst]] was selected during his rookie season.<ref name="MLS_allstar">{{cite web|title=All-Star: Tim Cahill, Robbie Keane, DeAndre Yedlin added to gameday roster; Landon Donovan left off|url=http://www.mlssoccer.com/all-star/2013/news/article/2013/07/15/all-star-tim-cahill-robbie-keane-deandre-yedlin-added-mls-gameday-roster-lan|work=MLSsoccer.com|publisher=Major League Soccer|accessdate=July 15, 2013|date=July 15, 2013}}</ref> Yedlin was ranked 3rd among MLS players under the age of 24 in 2013, according to MLSSoccer.com.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.mlssoccer.com/24under24/news/article/2013/09/20/3-deandre-yedlin-seattle-sounders |title=24 Under 24: #3 Deandre Yedlin |author=|date=September 20, 2013 |website= www.mlssoccer.com|publisher= MLSsoccer.com|accessdate=September 20, 2013}}</ref>
Yedlin scored his first professional league goal in a 1–1 draw with the [[Colorado Rapids]] on July 20, 2013.<ref name="Seattle Sounders 1, Colorado Rapids 1 | MLS Match Recap">{{cite web |title=Seattle Sounders 1, Colorado Rapids 1 {{!}} MLS Match Recap |url=http://www.mlssoccer.com/matchcenter/2013-07-20-SEA-v-COL/recap |publisher=Major League Soccer |accessdate=July 21, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130723021431/http://www.mlssoccer.com/matchcenter/2013-07-20-SEA-v-COL/recap |archivedate=July 23, 2013 }}</ref>
===Tottenham Hotspur=== On August 13, 2014, it was confirmed that Yedlin had signed a four-year contract with [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C.|Tottenham Hotspur]] of the [[Premier League]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/yedlin-move-agreed-130814/|title=Yedlin move agreed 13 August 2014 - News - tottenhamhotspur.com|publisher=|accessdate=August 23, 2016}}</ref><ref name=autogenerated1>[https://books.google.com/books?id=s7xiDwAAQBAJ&pg=PT83&dq=DeAndre+Yedlin&hl=en&sa=X&ved=0ahUKEwjGhuCdg4ncAhXKipQKHRlyCekQ6AEIPDAD#v=onepage&q=DeAndre%20Yedlin&f=false ''Soccer Thinking for Management Success: Lessons for organizations from the ...'' – Peter Loge<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> He remained with Seattle before joining Tottenham in January 2015. He trained with Tottenham for the first time on January 7, 2015.<ref>[http://www.soundersfc.com/post/2014/08/13/yedlins-meteoric-rise-continues-completed-move-epls-tottenham-hotspur "Yedlin's meteoric rise continues with completed move to the EPL's Tottenham Hotspur" | Seattle Sounders FC<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/30588234|title=DeAndre Yedlin: USA defender will join Tottenham in January|publisher=|accessdate=August 23, 2016}}</ref> He made his first appearance for the [[Tottenham Hotspur F.C. Reserves and Academy|under-21 team]] on January 9, 2015.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.tottenhamhotspur.com/news/u21s-wham-away-report-090115/|title=West Ham U21s 1-3 Spurs - report from Rush Green 9 January 2015 - tottenhamhotspur.com|publisher=|accessdate=August 23, 2016}}</ref> Yedlin made his Premier League debut on April 11, 2015, in a loss to [[Aston Villa F.C.|Aston Villa]].<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.espnfc.com/tottenham-hotspur/story/2394296/deandre-yedlin-says-making-premier-league-debut-with-tottenham-was-unbelievable|title=DeAndre Yedlin says making Premier League debut was 'unbelievable'|publisher=|accessdate=August 23, 2016}}</ref>
====Loan to Sunderland==== [[File:Sunderland 3 Chelsea 2 Costa Yedlin (cropped).jpg|thumb|upright|Yedlin playing for [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] in 2016]]
On September 1, 2015, [[Sunderland A.F.C.|Sunderland]] acquired Yedlin on a year-long loan.<ref name="Deadline-day move completed">{{cite web|title=Deadline-day move completed|url=http://www.safc.com/news/team-news/2015/september/deadline-day-move-completed|publisher=Sunderland A.F.C.|accessdate=September 1, 2015}}</ref><ref name=autogenerated1 /> On September 22, Yedlin made his Sunderland debut in a [[2015–16 Football League Cup|League Cup]] match, playing the full 90 minutes and notching an assist for the ''Black Cats''' only goal in a 4–1 loss to [[Manchester City F.C.|Manchester City]].<ref>[https://www.si.com/planet-futbol/2015/09/22/deandre-yedlin-sunderland-debut-assist-video-manchester-city]</ref> On October 3, 2015 Yedlin started his first Premier League game against [[West Ham United F.C.|West Ham United]].{{citation needed|date=August 2016}}
===Newcastle United=== On August 24, 2016, Yedlin moved to [[Newcastle United F.C.|Newcastle United]] for £5 million on a five-year contract.<ref name="Newcastle Yedlin Signing">{{Cite news |title=Is DeAndre Yedlin's transfer to Newcastle a good move for the American? |url=http://www.foxsports.com/soccer/story/is-deandre-yedlins-transfer-to-newcastle-a-good-move-for-the-american-082416 |publisher=FoxSports |date=August 24, 2016 |accessdate=October 1, 2016}}</ref><ref name=autogenerated3 /> He made his debut on August 27, in a match against [[Brighton and Hove Albion F.C.|Brighton and Hove Albion]] as an 88th-minute substitute for [[Yoan Gouffran]].<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/sport/football/37138687|title=Newcastle United 2–0 Brighton & Hove Albion – BBC Sport|date=August 27, 2016|website=bbc.co.uk|publisher=BBC Sport|access-date=August 29, 2016}}</ref> Two weeks later, Yedlin scored his first goal for the club and his first in three years in a 2–0 victory against [[Derby County F.C.|Derby County]] on September 10.<ref>{{Cite web|url=http://www.nufc.co.uk/page/Match/Report/0,,10278~5880654,00.html|title=Derby 0 Newcastle 2|date=September 10, 2016|website=nufc.co.uk|publisher=Newcastle United|access-date=September 10, 2016}}</ref> He scored his first Premier League goal on September 1, 2018 in a 2-1 defeat at Manchester City.<ref>{{Cite web|url=https://www.nufc.co.uk/matches/first-team/2018-19/manchester-city-v-newcastle-united|title=Manchester City 2 Newcastle United 1|website=Newcastle United Football Club|language=EN|access-date=September 11, 2018}}</ref>
==International career== Yedlin was named to the [[United States men's national under-20 soccer team|United States under-20]] squad on June 7, 2013, for the [[2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup]] in Turkey.<ref>{{cite web|title=U-20 MNT Head Coach Tab Ramos Names 21-Player Roster for 2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup in Turkey|url=http://www.ussoccer.com/news/u-20-mnt/2013/06/ramos-names-roster-for-2013-fifa-u20-world-cup-in-turkey.aspx|publisher=U.S. Soccer|accessdate=June 7, 2013|date=June 7, 2013|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130928034709/http://www.ussoccer.com/news/u-20-mnt/2013/06/ramos-names-roster-for-2013-fifa-u20-world-cup-in-turkey.aspx|archivedate=September 28, 2013}}</ref> Yedlin made his U-20 international debut a week later in a 3–1 victory over [[Portugal national under-20 football team|Portugal]].<ref>{{cite web |title=U.S. U-20 MNT Defeats Portugal U-20 Team 3–1 in Final Primer for 2013 FIFA U-20 World Cup |url=http://www.ussoccer.com/news/u-20-mnt/2013/06/u20-mnt-defeats-portugal-u20s-in-final-primer-for-world-cup.aspx |publisher=U.S. Soccer |accessdate=June 15, 2013 |date=June 14, 2013 |deadurl=yes |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130620184804/http://www.ussoccer.com/news/u-20-mnt/2013/06/u20-mnt-defeats-portugal-u20s-in-final-primer-for-world-cup.aspx |archivedate=June 20, 2013 }}</ref><ref name=autogenerated4 />
Yedlin earned his first call up to the [[United States men's national soccer team|senior men's national team]] on January 3, 2014.<ref>{{cite web|last=Firchau|first=Nick|url=http://www.mlssoccer.com/worldcup/2014/news/article/2014/01/03/world-cup-mls-mvp-mike-magee-headlines-27-man-january-camp-usmnt|title=World Cup: MLS MVP Mike Magee & Landon Donovan headline USMNT's January camp roster|work=MLSsoccer.com|publisher=Major League Soccer|date=January 3, 2014|accessdate=January 4, 2014}}</ref> He made his first appearance with the senior team on February 1, 2014, in a friendly against South Korea.<ref>[http://blogs.seattletimes.com/soundersfc/2014/02/02/usmnt-beats-south-korea-2-0-as-deandre-yedlin-earns-first-cap/ "USMNT beats South Korea, 2–0, as DeAndre Yedlin earns first cap" | Sounders FC | ''Seattle Times''<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
Yedlin was included on the U.S. final 23-man roster for the [[2014 FIFA World Cup]]. He made his World Cup debut against [[Portugal national football team|Portugal]], coming on as a late second-half substitute. He helped set up Sounders teammate [[Clint Dempsey]]'s late goal which put the U.S. up 2–1. He also came on late in the next game, a 1–0 loss v. Germany; his deep cross to Dempsey was headed off target. In the round of 16 match against [[Belgium national football team|Belgium]], Yedlin came on as a substitute for the injured [[Fabian Johnson]].<ref>[https://www.theepochtimes.com/fabian-johnson-usmnt-hoffenheim-right-back-could-be-key-for-usa-against-belgium_781508.html "Fabian Johnson Injury Today: DeAndre Yedlin Replaces USMNT, Hoffenheim Right Back for USA Against Belgium" | ''The Epoch Times''<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
In the 2016 Copa America Centenario, Yedlin received a second [[Penalty card#Yellow card|yellow card]] (and subsequent red) in a match against Paraguay.<ref>[https://www.denverpost.com/2016/06/11/us-reaches-copa-america-quarters-with-1-0-win-over-paraguay/ "U.S. reaches Copa America Centenario quarterfinals with 1–0 win over Paraguay" – ''The Denver Post''<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
==Personal life== Yedlin was born and raised in [[Seattle]], Washington.<ref name=autogenerated2>[https://www.jweekly.com/2014/09/05/celebrity-jews-09-05-14/ "celebrity jews" – ''J''<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> His father is of [[African American]], [[People of the Dominican Republic|Dominican]], and [[Native Americans in the United States|Native American]] descent.<ref>[https://www.thesun.co.uk/sport/football/5941229/newcastle-star-deandre-yedlin-reveals-his-troubled-family-tale-through-his-tattoos/ "Newcastle star DeAndre Yedlin reveals his troubled family tale through his tattoos"<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref> Yedlin and his mother are [[Jewish]]; his family is from [[Latvia]].<ref>[https://www.jweekly.com/2015/02/27/celebrithy-jews0227/ celebrity jews – J<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref>[https://www.jewishtampa.com/jews-in-the-news/jews-in-the-news-mila-kunis "Jews in the News: Mila Kunis, Jesse Eisenberg and Chelsea Handler" | Tampa Jewish Federation<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref><ref name="profile"/><ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.jweekly.com/article/full/72539/celebrity-jews-09-05-14/|title=celebrity jews|last=Bloom|first=Nate|publisher=j. the Jewish news weekly of Northern California|accessdate=August 23, 2016}}</ref><ref name="SportsPressNW">{{cite web |url=http://sportspressnw.com/2155958/2013/play-of-sounders-yedlin-catching-up-to-his-hair |title=PLAY OF SOUNDERS’ YEDLIN CATCHING UP TO HIS HAIR |publisher=NW Sports Press |year=2013|accessdate=July 1, 2014}}</ref>
Yedlin is very close with his mother, Rebecca Yedlin, who had him when she was very young and is now a college sports instructor; his father has never been part of his life.<ref name=autogenerated2 /><ref name="profile">{{cite news|url=http://mobile.nytimes.com/2014/07/06/sports/worldcup/mls-pins-hope-on-a-us-standout-at-the-world-cup.html?rref=sports/worldcup&module=ArrowsNav&contentCollection=World%20Cup&action=keypress&_r=3&referrer= |title=Looking for Breakout Star, M.L.S. Pins Hopes on a World Cup Standout |publisher=[[New York Times]] |date=July 5, 2014|accessdate=July 6, 2014 |author=Jorge Arangure Jr.}}</ref> He was raised by his maternal grandfather, Ira Nathan Yedlin, and step-grandmother, Vicki Walton.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://www.goal.com/en-us/news/2617/youth-soccer/2011/02/22/2364319/en-route-seattle-sounders-academys-deandre-yedlin|title=En Route: Seattle Sounders Academy's DeAndre Yedlin - Goal.com|date=February 22, 2011|publisher=|accessdate=August 23, 2016}}</ref><ref name=autogenerated2 /> Yedlin has a sister Jenea who is three years younger than he is.<ref>[https://www.nytimes.com/2014/07/06/sports/worldcup/mls-pins-hope-on-a-us-standout-at-the-world-cup.html "World Cup 2018"<!-- Bot generated title -->]</ref>
Yedlin began playing soccer at age four and learned while watching his uncle from the sideline. Seattle Sounders youth director [[Darren Sawatzky]] first saw him play at age 11 and later said that Yedlin was "an offensive player at the time, he was tricky, he had explosiveness and could run for days." Said [[Seattle Sounders FC|Sounders FC]] sporting director Chris Henderson of Yedlin: "DeAndre has great quickness and speed. He reads the game well, keeps possession, but he's able to attack the flank and get crosses in."<ref name="U23-interview">{{cite web |url=http://www.soundersu23.com/home/636607.html |title=Getting to Know the U-23's – DeAndre Yedlin |publisher=Seattle Sounders FC U-23 |year=2012 |accessdate=June 4, 2013|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20130306052125/http://www.soundersu23.com/home/636607.html|archivedate=March 6, 2013 }}</ref>

!161!!3!!10!!1!!6!!0!!4!!1!!181!!5 |}
===International=== {{updated|November 15, 2018.}}<ref name=NFT>{{NFT player |id=54575|name=Yedlin, DeAndre |accessdate=August 12, 2018}}</ref>

==Honors==
